newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgium to sell 74.03 pct of bank in privatisation.
newsitem.headline: Belgium to sell 74.03 pct of bank in privatisation.

text.p: Belgian state holding company SFP/FPM said in a notice in Belgian newspapers on Tuesday it was putting 74.03 percent of publicly-owned bank Credit Professionnel/Beroepskrediet up for sale.
The bank's remaining shares are held by 10 regional branches that make up its network.
Belgian brokerage Petercam had been charged with overseeing the operation, it said.
Credit Professionnel/Beroepskrediet had total assets of 164 billion francs at the end of 1996, SFP/FPM said. Net profit was 264 million francs for a return on equity of 9.67 percent.
